title: Welcome to the Ethiopian Biometric Society
text: Advancing Life Sciences through Statistical Excellence

title: Welcome to the Ethiopian Society
text:
SUSAN 2025 Conference
The Ethiopian Region, founded in 1999, is an active Region of IBS. In addition to this, they are a member of the Sub-Sahara African Network, or SUSAN, which is a network of national biometric groups of the Sub-Saharan Africa countries who promote the advancement of life sciences through development, application, and dissemination of effective mathematical and statistical methods.
Click to learn more


This includes applications in agriculture, medical and health research, infectious diseases, environment and ecology, climate, and other applied sciences such as the areas of statistical genetics and bioinformatics.

Show less

title: Welcome to the Ethiopian Biometric Society
text:
About the Conference
The IBS SUSAN Sept 2025 Conference will be hosted in Ethiopia. This event will provide a platform for sharing cutting-edge research, fostering collaboration, and advancing knowledge in the fields of mathematical and statistical methodologies within the life sciences, with a particular focus on the diverse challenges and opportunities in Sub-Saharan Africa.
Click to learn more


This includes applications in agriculture, medical and health research, infectious diseases, and more.

Show less

title: Welcome to the Ethiopian Society
text:
Contact Us
Click to learn more


Reach out to us for more details about the SUSAN 2025 conference.

Show less

title: Thank You
text: Thank you for registering! We’ll get back to you soon.

title: Programmes
text:
Running Code
When you click the Render button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

1 + 1

[1] 2


You can add options to executable code like this


[1] 4


The echo: false option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

title: Home
text:
The Ethiopian Region, founded in 1999, is an active Region of IBS. In addition to this, they are a member of the Sub-Sahara African Network, or SUSAN, which is a network of national biometric groups of the Sub-Saharan Africa countries who promote the advancement of life sciences through development, application and dissemination of effective mathematical and statistical methods to its members and collaborating partners. This includes applications in agriculture, medical and health research, infectious diseases, environment and ecology, climate, and other applied sciences such as the areas of statistical genetics and bioinformatics.
The IBS SUSAN Sept 2025 Conference will be hosted in Ethiopia. This event will provide a platform for sharing cutting-edge research, fostering collaboration, and advancing knowledge in the fields of mathematical and statistical methodologies within the life sciences, with a particular focus on the diverse challenges and opportunities in Sub-Saharan Africa.

title: Home
text:
The Ethiopian Region, founded in 1999, is an active Region of IBS. In addition to this, they are a member of the Sub-Sahara African Network, or SUSAN, which is a network of national biometric groups of the Sub-Saharan Africa countries who promote the advancement of life sciences through development, application and dissemination of effective mathematical and statistical methods to its members and collaborating partners. This includes applications in agriculture, medical and health research, infectious diseases, environment and ecology, climate, and other applied sciences such as the areas of statistical genetics and bioinformatics.
The IBS SUSAN Sept 2025 Conference will be hosted in Ethiopia. This event will provide a platform for sharing cutting-edge research, fostering collaboration, and advancing knowledge in the fields of mathematical and statistical methodologies within the life sciences, with a particular focus on the diverse challenges and opportunities in Sub-Saharan Africa.

title: Welcome to the Ethiopian Biometric Society
text:
Ethiopiaan Biometry Society (EBS)
The Ethiopian Region, founded in 1999, is an active Region of IBS. In addition to this, they are a member of the Sub-Sahara African Network, or SUSAN, which is a network of national biometric groups of the Sub-Saharan Africa countries who promote the advancement of life sciences through development, application, and dissemination of effective mathematical and statistical methods.
Click to learn more


This includes applications in agriculture, medical and health research, infectious diseases, environment and ecology, climate, and other applied sciences such as the areas of statistical genetics and bioinformatics.

Show less
